unsigned int QAviWriter::audioChannelCount (  ) 

Returns the number of channels in the audio file.

Returns:
0 if there's no audio track set or 1 for mono and 2 for stereo.

References d_audio_file_name, and d_audio_format.

bool QAviWriter::close (  ) 

This function should be called when the program is done adding video frames to the AVI file. It adds the audio track if a valid audio file name was defined, frees the memory allocated and properly closes the output file.

Returns:
true on success or false if an error occured.

Referenced by setCodec().

bool QAviWriter::open (  ) 

This is the first function you should call when using QAviWriter. It allocates memory and takes care of initializing the AVI header with the provided information.

Returns:
true on success or false if an error occured.

Referenced by QAviWriter().

bool QAviWriter::setSize ( const QSize &  size  ) 

This function allows you to reset the video size.

This function allows you to reset the video size. In a standard use case, you should not need to call it. However, if you need to, you can call it to reset the video height and width set in the AVI file after you are done adding frames to your AVI file and before you call close().

Returns:
true on success, false on error.
